Content.Text:
<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I just happened to be in the area, so I thought I
might come to call upon you.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is quite the lovely farm you have. Plenty of
room for some fine flowerbeds.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
That reminds me! If you don't mind,
<MYNAME>, I have a request.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You see, my fields are all committed to growing
grains, and I haven't any space for flowers.
Would you plant some for me?

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<WINDOW_ROSE_R>I'd like for you to raise <BLUE>Carnations</BLUE>, specifically.
Their seeds aren't easy to acquire, so it's all right
if you take your time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Quality blossoms are preferred, of course, but
since you'd be doing this as a favor, I won't be
too fussy.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>At any rate, for my research I'd like to observe
some <BLUE>Carnations</BLUE> you raised here on your farm.
<PAGE>
Raised normally, mind you. I'd prefer if you
didn't use a greenhouse or any other special
methods.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Anyway, I'm sure you have your own business to
attend to, so I'll try not to ride you too hard
about it.
<PAGE>
Whenever you can find the time, see if you can
raise a <BLUE>Carnation</BLUE> from seed to bloom.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, I'll drop by once it has bloomed.
Oh...and this is the most important thing...
<PAGE>
Once it has bloomed, don't pick it. Just leave the
flower in the soil, so that I may observe it in its
natural state.

<FACE_GEORGES><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
<WINDOW_ROSE_R>I'm sorry to ask so much of you. Please, feel free
to take your time. I await your result with bated
breath.
